intro: Diplostephium ericoides, commonly known as the heath-like spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and disturbed areas. Its small, clustered flowers are usually greenish-yellow, and it produces capsules as its fruit. The leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a leathery texture, contributing to its adaptability in harsh environments.
